sentences.en: An exultant party leader said: "He will be an excellent MP."
sentences.cn: 一位面带欢欣的政党领导人说：“他会成为一名出色的议员。”

sentences.en: He raises arms to the sky, turning slowly, feeling the rain washing him clean. Exultant. Triumphant.
sentences.cn: 他冲着天空张开双臂, 慢慢地转身, 让雨水将自己冲刷干净, 欣喜、狂欢!

sentences.en: He sent one glare of fierce , exultant defiance at the man in collar and cravat now.
sentences.cn: 他横眉冷目,满脸鄙夷之色, 狠狠地盯了一眼那位现在戴好衣领和系着领带的人.

sentences.en: He was exultant that she was still so much in his power.
sentences.cn: 他仍然能轻而易举地摆布她,对此他欣喜若狂.

sentences.en: Intense and especially ecstatic or exultant happiness.
sentences.cn: 表现或引起高兴或喜悦;尤其是使幸福.

sentences.en: That night, tired, exultant, he wrote about the operation and sent a note to Marian Scott.
sentences.cn: 那天夜里, 他又疲倦又欣喜, 给玛丽安?斯科特写了一封短信谈这次手术.

sentences.en: The exultant crowds were dancing in the streets.
sentences.cn: 欢欣的人群在大街上跳起了舞.

sentences.en: The exultant players were dancing on the ground over their team's victory.
sentences.cn: 欢呼雀跃的运动员们在运动场上起舞以庆祝队伍的胜利.

sentences.en: The young gentleman uttered this exultant sound with mysterious significance.
sentences.cn: 这位少爷发出这种兴高采烈的呼喊是带有神秘的意思的.

sentences.en: There is something fine about the exultant spring and the boat.
sentences.cn: 小艇欢快地跳跃,确是别有一番妙趣.

sentences.en: There is something fine about the exultant spring of the boat.
sentences.cn: 小艇充满欢跃的活力,确是别有一番妙趣.

sentences.en: Whooah! The exultant joy of survival.

words.tran_cn: 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴
非常高兴的；欢跃的；狂喜的；欢欣鼓舞的

trans.tran_en: If you are exultant, you feel very happy and proud about something you have done
